How to Install libghc-setlocale-dev on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libghc-setlocale-dev

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libghc-setlocale-dev on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libghc-setlocale-dev on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libghc-setlocale-dev in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libghc-setlocale-dev, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libghc-setlocale-dev Using apt

To install libghc-setlocale-dev in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libghc-setlocale-dev using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libghc-setlocale-dev

The installation of libghc-setlocale-dev might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libghc-setlocale-dev Using apt-get

To install libghc-setlocale-dev using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libghc-setlocale-dev.

sudo apt-get -y install libghc-setlocale-dev

Install libghc-setlocale-dev Using Synaptic

To install libghc-setlocale-dev using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libghc-setlocale-dev on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libghc-setlocale-dev. This will display the libghc-setlocale-dev package in the package window, now to install libghc-setlocale-dev, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libghc-setlocale-dev package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libghc-setlocale-dev.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libghc-setlocale-dev Using aptitude

To install libghc-setlocale-dev on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libghc-setlocale-dev.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libghc-setlocale-dev using the command aptitude install libghc-setlocale-dev.

sudo aptitude -y install libghc-setlocale-dev

How to Upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev on debian

If you want to upgrade the libghc-setlocale-dev package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev

Upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev using Aptitude

To upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev

Upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev using Synaptic

To upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libghc-setlocale-dev, now right-click libghc-setlocale-dev, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libghc-setlocale-dev on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libghc-setlocale-dev from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libghc-setlocale-dev, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libghc-setlocale-dev

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libghc-setlocale-dev

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libghc-setlocale-dev you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libghc-setlocale-dev

Remove libghc-setlocale-dev using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libghc-setlocale-dev using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libghc-setlocale-dev, right-click the libghc-setlocale-dev package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libghc-setlocale-dev click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libghc-setlocale-dev on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libghc-setlocale-dev using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libghc-setlocale-dev then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
